## Public Member Functions

### adjustForHiPEPrologue() {#afd992a2165073c9cea53128d5b6c4145}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86FrameLowering::adjustForHiPEPrologue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; PrologueMBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Erlang programs may need a special prologue to handle the stack size they might need at runtime.

That is because Erlang/OTP does not implement a C stack but uses a custom implementation of hybrid stack/heap architecture. (for more information see Eric Stenman&#39;s Ph.D. thesis: <a href="http://publications.uu.se/uu/fulltext/nbn_se_uu_diva-2688.pdf">http://publications.uu.se/uu/fulltext/nbn&#95;se&#95;uu&#95;diva-2688.pdf</a>)

CheckStack: temp0 = sp - MaxStack if( temp0 &lt; SP&#95;LIMIT(P) ) goto IncStack else goto OldStart OldStart: ... IncStack: call inc&#95;stack # doubles the stack space temp0 = sp - MaxStack if( temp0 &lt; SP&#95;LIMIT(P) ) goto IncStack else goto OldStart

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h">X86FrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp/#l03548">3548</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp">X86FrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a6cbb50454d9bb068f4ab6b2d08fb7abf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86FrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h">X86FrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp/#l03174">3174</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp">X86FrameLowering.cpp</a>.

emitProlog/emitEpilog - These methods insert prolog and epilog code into the function.

emitPrologue - Push callee-saved registers onto the stack, which automatically adjust the stack pointer.

### getFrameIndexReference() {#a84fbe17f451c957c67de546c98f2b79b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StackOffset X86FrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, int FI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; FrameReg) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getFrameIndexReference - This method should return the base register and offset used to reference a frame index location.

Returns the displacement from the frame register to the stack frame of the specified index, along with the frame register used (in output arg FrameReg).

The offset is returned directly, and the base register is returned via FrameReg.

This is the default implementation which is overridden for some targets.

### getFrameIndexReferencePreferSP() {#afb20caf4eb8695705452f25d78a18a06}

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Same as <code>getFrameIndexReference</code>, except that the stack pointer (as opposed to the frame pointer) will be the preferred value for <code>FrameReg</code>.

This is generally used for emitting statepoint or EH tables that use offsets from RSP. If <code>IgnoreSPUpdates</code> is true, the returned offset is only guaranteed to be valid with respect to the value of SP at the end of the prologue.

### spillFPBP() {#a068e9d1fd54621ae340f26c41d170a1a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86FrameLowering::spillFPBP (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
If a function uses base pointer and the base pointer is clobbered by inline asm, RA doesn&#39;t detect this case, and after the inline asm, the base pointer contains garbage value.

For example if a 32b x86 function uses base pointer esi, and esi is clobbered by following inline asm asm(&quot;rep movsb&quot; : &quot;+D&quot;(ptr), &quot;+S&quot;(x), &quot;+c&quot;(c)::&quot;memory&quot;); We need to save esi before the asm and restore it after the asm.

The problem can also occur to frame pointer if there is a function call, and the callee uses a different calling convention and clobbers the fp.

Because normal frame objects (spill slots) are accessed through fp/bp register, so we can&#39;t spill fp/bp to normal spill slots.

FIXME: There are 2 possible enhancements:
<ul>
<li>In many cases there are different physical registers not clobbered by inline asm, we can use one of them as base pointer. Or use a virtual register as base pointer and let RA allocate a physical register to it.</li>
<li>If there is no other instructions access stack with fp/bp from the inline asm to the epilog, and no cfi requirement for a correct fp, we can skip the save and restore operations.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h/#l00106">106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h">X86FrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp/#l04517">4517</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-cpp">X86FrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Uses64BitFramePtr {#abb804392ca8368795013f2e5dc001ee2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::X86FrameLowering::Uses64BitFramePtr">
True if the 64-bit frame or stack pointer should be used.

True for most 64-bit targets with the exception of x32. If this is false, 32-bit instruction operands should be used to manipulate StackPtr and FramePtr.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h/#l00048">48</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86framelowering-h">X86FrameLowering.h</a>.
